definition: to dodge/to duck out of the way/to beat it/shaken (by a fall)/to sprain/to pull a muscle/lightning/spark/a flash/to flash (across one's mind)/to leave behind/(Internet slang) (of a display of affection) "dazzlingly" saccharine

sentences.english: When the camera's flash went off, the tiger roared and disappeared, he said.
sentences.chinese: 他說當他的相機閃光燈閃起時，老虎吼叫着消失了。

sentences.english: The built-in LED flash does double duty.
sentences.chinese: 在LED閃光燈內置有雙重的責任。

sentences.english: Another tell-tale sign of misused on-camera flash is the dark tunnel effect.
sentences.chinese: 另一個濫用機頂閃光燈的典型是黑色背景效果。

sentences.english: It also came with a dual LED flash which certainly helped.
sentences.chinese: 它也帶來了雙LED閃光燈，這當然有幫助。

sentences.english: He attached a flashgun to his camera.
sentences.chinese: 他把閃光燈裝到照相機上。

sentences.english: We once again used the strobe as the main light and kept the wall in shadow.
sentences.chinese: 同樣我是用閃光燈作爲主光源，將牆保持在陰影裏面。

sentences.english: The excitation source was a flashlamp pumped rhodamine tunable dye laser .
sentences.chinese: 激發源爲閃光燈泵可調諧若丹明染科雷射器。

sentences.english: Remember above how the flash sends out a pre-flash?
sentences.chinese: 還記得前面提到的閃光燈預閃嗎？

sentences.english: There 's a build-in flashgun in this camera.
sentences.chinese: 這架照相機有一個內置閃光燈。

sentences.english: We have a nice mock up design in flash and aftereffect.
sentences.chinese: 我們有一個不錯的閃光燈和後效模擬了設計。

sentences.english: Flashlights are not listed explicitly in Annex IB of the WEEE Directive.
sentences.chinese: WEEE指令附錄IB中沒有明確列出閃光燈。

sentences.english: The camera zoomed in on audience members tearing up as well.
sentences.chinese: 當觀衆們頻頻拭淚時，閃光燈來回縮放。

sentences.english: It only matters if youshoot in the dark, and then shoot without flash.
sentences.chinese: 它只有你在暗光下拍攝並且不適用閃光燈時纔會重要。

sentences.english: Signal a turn with your blinker / or your hand.
sentences.chinese: 轉彎的時候打一下閃光燈或者用你的手示意一下。

sentences.english: Something seems wrong with the photoflash in my camera.
sentences.chinese: 我相機的閃光燈似乎有毛病。

definition: body of a vehicle or machine/fuselage of a plane
film/roll of film/also written 膠捲|胶卷
